intro: Galium asperuliflorum, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable component of its native habitat.
